summary: The concept of "hypertext" pertains to the structuring and linking of digital information, allowing for non-linear navigation through interconnected documents. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, hypertext plays a crucial role in enhancing accessibility and transparency of legal texts, directives, and regulations. By facilitating the integration of various legal documents, hypertext supports efficient data processing and retrieval, enabling stakeholders to navigate complex legal landscapes. This interconnectedness is vital for ensuring compliance and understanding of EU legislation, thereby fostering an informed citizenry and promoting the rule of law within the digital domain.
